CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Failed Distributed Account Probe
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: The same external account unsuccessfully attempts to authenticate to multiple hosts within a short period of time.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Failed Distributed Brute Force
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple failed authentication attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login, without seeing an authentication success.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Port Sweep
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Inbound TCP/UDP traffic on the same port to multiple internal hosts.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Port Sweep: Common Port
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Inbound TCP/UDP traffic on the same common port to multiple internal hosts.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Port Scan: Slow
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: External host slowly sending traffic to over 20 ports on an internal host, indicating a possible advanced port scan.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Ping Sweep
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Inbound ICMP packets from one source to multiple internal hosts.
Modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Port Scan
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: External host sending traffic to over 40 ports on an internal host, indicating a possible port scan.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Internal Ping Sweep
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal host sending ICMP packets to multiple internal hosts within a short period of time.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Internal Port Sweep
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal host sweeping the internal network with traffic on the same port.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Internal Port Sweep: Common Port
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal host sweeping the internal network with traffic on the same common ports: 25, 80, 443, 514, etc.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Internal Port Scan
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal host sending traffic to over 40 ports on another internal host, indicating a possible port scan.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Internal Port Scan: Slow
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Internal host slowly sending traffic to over 20 ports on another internal host, indicating a possible advanced port scan.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Excessive HTTP Errors
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Excessive HTTP Error Codes seen on the same Impacted Host, originating from the same Origin Host, indicating some sort of automated scanning activity.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: SQL Injection Detected
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Common URL-encoded SQL Injection string in a URL. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 18.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) Detected
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Common URL-encoded <script> tags in a URL, indicating a reflected cross-site scripting attack. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 18.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Directory Traversal URL
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Use of special characters related to directory traversal observed in a URL. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 18.2, CSC 8.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: URL Directory Traversal
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attempt to perform dot dot directory traversals using URL parameters.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Metasploit Activity Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Observed traffic on port 4444, the default port for most Metasploit attack vector.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Reconnaissance Activity Alert Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any reconnaissance activity in supplemental support of PCI-DSS Controls: 11.4.a-c. 12.10.5

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP : Reconnaissance Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on reconnaissance within the organization infrastructure.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53 : Reconnaissance Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on reconnaissance activity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: New Network Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A new host is seen communicating in the environment for the first time. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 1.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13 : Reconnaissance Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This report directly supports GPG-13 controls PMC5.2, PMC5.4, and PMC5.8 by providing details of all reconnaissance activity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Outbound UDP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Large number of UDP packets sent from a single external host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Outbound TCP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Large number of TCP packets sent from a single internal host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Outbound ICMP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Large number of ICMP packets sent from a single internal host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Inbound Traffic fm NonWhitelist Country
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Inbound connection from a suspicious country defined as being absent in the "Network: Whitelisted Countries" list. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Excessive Inbound Firewall Denies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: For this rule we look for an excessive number (400) of network denied events from a host within 5 minutes. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 6.5, CSC 12.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Allowed Traffic from Blacklist Country
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Inbound connection from a suspicious country specified in the list "Network: Blacklisted Countries". CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Blocked Traffic then Allowed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: 400 or more instances of denied network traffic from an external source, followed by a network allow event. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.3

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Drupal Username Enumeration
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attacker attempts to enumerate more than 5 users from within a Drupal application within a time period of 1 minute.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Reconnaissance Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on reconnaissance activity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Excessive Inbound Firewall Denies
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: For this rule we look for an excessive number (400) of network denied events from a host within 5 minutes.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Blocked ExternalTraffic then Allow
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: 400 or more instances of denied network traffic from an external source, followed by a network allow event.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Blacklisted Ingress Port
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: An external host communicates with a network host on a port not on the allowed ingress list.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: External Malicious User-Agent
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: User agent string used by hacking/security research tools found in web server logs. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.2, CSC 8.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: External Malicious URL Characters
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Malicious characters in the URL string found in web server log. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.2, CSC 8.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Reconnaissance Activity Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any reconnaissance activity.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: URL Directory Traversal Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Alarm generated from an IDS/IPS or WAF event attempting a directory traversal.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: External Brute Force Auths
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Successful authentication after multiple failed attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Failed Distributed Account Probe
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: The same external account unsuccessfully attempts to authenticate to multiple hosts within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Recon: Failed Distributed Brute Force
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple failed authentication attempts from different external origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login, without seeing an authentication success.
